page.title: 16The End of Chevet Hall
page.content: On July 26,l955 a sale of the contents of Chevet Hall was held at the Hall. The sale was attended by many people including the grandmother of one of my friends. Apart from the many local people who were there in the hope of gaining a souvenir there were antique dealers from all over the country. All sorts of items were offered for sale from whole staircases to doors and fabrics. My friend's grandmother did not buy anything because most of the items were too expensive to buy. It was an unusual experioence for the local people who went to see parts of the Hall being sold off. Immediately after the sale of items demolition started.The land on which the Hall stood was sold and a more modern house is there in its place.The Park contains a large Garden Centre.
